skill: How to Throw a One-Inch Punch

phases.name: basic_stance_and_posture
phases.cue: Imagine you're sitting back into a chair to find the right knee bend.
phases.pose_hints: Stand with your feet shoulder-width apart, toes pointed forward. Keep your knees bent and back straight, with your weight distributed evenly on both legs.
phases.rationale: This provides a stable base and helps generate power from your legs.

phases.name: arm_position_and_relaxation
phases.cue: Focus on keeping your arms and shoulders loose and springy.
phases.pose_hints: Hold your arms up, elbows bent and relaxed, with your fists near your chest. Keep your shoulders down and relaxed, and your elbows close to your body.
phases.rationale: This position allows for a quick, snapping motion and utilizes the full range of motion in your arms.

phases.name: weight_shift_and_rotation
phases.cue: Think of 'sitting back' on your back leg, then exploding forward.
phases.pose_hints: Shift your weight onto your back leg, then quickly shift it forward onto your front leg while rotating your hips and torso. This weight transfer and rotation adds power to the punch.
phases.rationale: This movement engages your core and larger muscle groups, generating more force.

phases.name: snap_the_punch
phases.cue: Focus on speed and a sudden release of tension, like a whip.
phases.pose_hints: As your weight shifts forward, snap your punching arm straight out, rotating your fist so your knuckles are facing down at impact. Keep your arm relaxed until the moment of impact, then immediately retract.
phases.rationale: Relaxing the arm increases speed, and the snapping motion adds force to the punch.

phases.name: distance_and_timing
phases.cue: Visualize your arm as a coiled spring, releasing its energy at the perfect moment.
phases.pose_hints: Practice gauging the correct distance for the punch by starting with your fist one inch away from the target. Time your punch so that your arm is fully extended just as your fist makes contact.
phases.rationale: This step ensures you understand the precise timing and distance required for maximum effect.

phases.name: combine_the_elements
phases.cue: Focus on smoothness and precision. Ensure each element flows into the next without hesitation.
phases.pose_hints: Integrate all the previous steps into one fluid motion: stance, arm relaxation, weight shift, rotation, and snapping the punch. Practice slowly at first, then increase speed as you gain control.
phases.rationale: This step brings together all the individual components to create a powerful one-inch punch.

constraints.workspace_hint: short to medium range combat movements
